SponsoredOfficers in protective forensic suits, gloves and masks were seen entering the property in a street made up of large semi-detached houses and flats.
Scotland Yard said the woman was known to the boy but could not confirm the relationship between the two.
Officers believe they know his identity but are awaiting formal identification.

title: Roman Frackiewicz: Woman found dead at home had 14 fractured ribs, murder trial told
text:
Jadwiga Szczygielska’s injuries were in keeping with blunt force blows, the High Court in Edinburgh was told

An elderly woman alleged to have been murdered by a lodger in her home had sustained extensive chest injuries, a court has been told.

Jadwiga Szczygielska, 77, sustained 14 fractured ribs and a broken breastbone as well as collapsed lungs and a rupture to the heart.

Sponsored

Ian Wilkinson, a consultant forensic pathologist who carried out a post-mortem examination, told the High Court in Edinburgh that a traffic collision would be one situation where he would expect to see such injuries.

The court was told that they could be in keeping with blunt force blows to the chest or the application of sustained blunt force pressure.

Roman Frackiewicz denies murdering Ms Szczygielska at the flat where they lived in Seafield, Edinburgh, on April 17 last year.
summary:

title: Sarah Everard: Body found in woodland confirmed as missing woman
text:
Sarah Everard vanished from Clapham, south London, as she walked home last week

Human remains discovered in woodland in Kent have been formally identified as those of the missing 33-year-old Sarah Everard, police said today.

Search teams found the body on Wednesday, a week after she vanished from Clapham, south London, as she walked home around 9pm.

Sponsored

Nick Ephgrave, Metropolitan Police assistant commissioner, said: “The body has now been recovered and formal identification procedure has now been undertaken. I can now confirm that it is the body of Sarah Everard.”

Police confirm body found in Kent woodland identified as Sarah Everard

He said that her family had been told.

Speaking in Northern Ireland, Boris Johnson said: “Like everybody I’m shocked and appalled about the news from the Met about Sarah Everard.

title: Accused of Murdering Our Son: The Steven Clark Story review — no one has a clue in this fascinating mystery
text:
Accused of Murdering Our Son: The Steven Clark Story

ITV

★★★☆☆



This Is My House

BBC1

★★☆☆☆

The disappearance of Steven Clark is a proper, tragic, old-fashioned mystery and one which I felt at the end of Accused of Murdering Our Son: The Steven Clark Story might never be solved. In 1992 a 23-year-old man walked into a seaside public toilet while his mother visited the ladies and was never seen again. Apart from a couple of alleged sightings in the days afterwards, it is as though he has vanished off the face of the Earth. It’s the sort of thing Netflix might make a moody true-crime documentary about if the leads weren’t so scant and it was Salt Lake City not Saltburn-by-the-Sea in North

title: Karima Baloch: Dissidents accuse Pakistan of murdering exiled activist
text:
A Pakistani activist living in exile after openly criticising the military has been found dead in Canada, prompting claims that she was murdered by the state.

The body of 37-year-old Karima Baloch, whose campaigning focused on rights violations in the province of Balochistan, was found in Toronto on Monday, a day after she went missing.

Sponsored

Toronto police, who had issued an appeal over her whereabouts, tweeted that she had been “located”. The cause of death was still unknown but police said that it was not believed to be suspicious.

“The investigators have determined that this was a non-criminal death,” a spokeswoman said.

The news sent shockwaves through Pakistani social media, with human rights groups demanding an investigation. Ms Baloch was a former head of the
summary:
A Pakistani activist living in exile after openly criticising the military has been found dead in Canada, prompting claims that she was murdered by the state.
The body of 37-year-old Karima Baloch, whose campaigning focused on rights violations in the province of Balochistan, was found in Toronto on Monday, a day after she went missing.
SponsoredToronto police, who had issued an appeal over her whereabouts, tweeted that she had been “located”.
The cause of death was still unknown but police said that it was not believed to be suspicious.
The news sent shockwaves through Pakistani social media, with human rights groups demanding an investigation.

title: Michel Fourniret: Ogre of Ardennes admits murder of a 12th woman
text:
Michel Fourniret, centre, in 2006. He is serving a life sentence without parole for the murders of seven women and girls

France’s most notorious living serial killer has admitted killing a 29-year-old woman in 1993, bringing to 12 the murders he is known to have committed.

Michel Fourniret, 78, known as the Ogre of the Ardennes, acknowledged that he was responsible for the death of Lydie Logé, who vanished from Saint-Christophe-le-Jajolet in Normandy.

Sponsored

Fourniret has been serving a life sentence without parole since 2008 for the murders of seven women and girls in France and Belgium. Police confronted him with DNA from a mattress in his van that matched that of Logé’s mother.

The killer, who has played a cat-and-mouse game with his interrogators, said: “I do not think that it could be anyone else but me who put an end to her passage through
summary:

title: Sarah Everard’s family tell of strong, principled woman — a shining example
text:
Sarah Everard’s family said in a statement that she was “a wonderful daughter and sister”

The family of Sarah Everard last night paid tribute to her as a kind, thoughtful and caring “shining example to us all” as they issued an appeal for information on her suspected murder.

Everard, 33, a marketing executive, vanished while walking back to her home in Brixton, south London, last Wednesday night. Police said a week later that human remains had been discovered in woodland near Ashford, Kent, though they have not yet been formally identified.

Sponsored

Wayne Couzens, 48, a serving Metropolitan Police officer, has been arrested on suspicion of murder and kidnap. He is in custody.

Everard’s family said last night: “Our beautiful daughter Sarah was taken from us and we are appealing for any information that will help to solve this terrible crime.
